definition: to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to exist/to be/existence
to deposit money (in a bank etc)/bank savings/bank deposit
property or cash held in reserve/stock
to exist/to survive
internal storage/computer memory/random access memory (RAM)
to store up/to stockpile/(computer) to save/to store/memory/storage
to conserve/to preserve/to keep/to save (a file etc) (computing)
stockpile/to store/to stockpile/storage
to deposit/to store/to leave in sb's care
passbook/bankbook
to exist at the same time/to coexist
survivor
to sequester/to seal up (for safe keeping)/to freeze (an account)/to mothball
extant/existent/in stock
stock/inventory (of material)

sentences.english: There's no doubt in your mind about his aim ?
sentences.chinese: 对他的目的你心里不存疑虑吧？

sentences.english: As the original trail has not existed for a long time, the researchers mostly use the tablet rubbings as their basis.
sentences.chinese: 碑之原迹早已不存，研究者大多是以拓本摩本为据。

sentences.english: The classics also preserve traditional values that have survived for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 经典作品还能保持几个世纪以来存留下来的传统价值。

sentences.english: Keeping water clean, mountain green, sky clear and harmony.
sentences.chinese: 为广东人民留绿水青山，存碧海蓝天，共享和谐。

sentences.english: She set aside one-tenth of her salary each month.
sentences.chinese: 她每个月将薪水的十分之一存起来。

sentences.english: The official has squirreled away a large sum of money in foreign bank.
sentences.chinese: 这位官员在外国银行存了一大笔钱。

sentences.english: I only need to save up for the dowry, which is manageable.
sentences.chinese: 我只需要给他存嫁妆钱了，这就比较好办了。

sentences.english: It may also be hidden in cheap imported medicines of dubious origin.
sentences.chinese: 另外，来历不明的廉价进口药物中可能也存这种成分。

sentences.english: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
sentences.chinese: 所以你们不可丢弃勇敢的心，存这样的心必得大赏赐。

sentences.english: Here’s how one GRS reader uses haggling to save big bucks.
sentences.chinese: 这里是一位读者用来讨价还价，存大钱的方法。

sentences.english: The Commodity must be fully insured for all losses.
sentences.chinese: 所存货物必须投保一切损失险。

sentences.english: For we go seeking a city that we shall never find.
sentences.chinese: 因为我们正在寻觅之城永远不存。

sentences.english: But all in a word, I firmly oppose saving cash dough.
sentences.chinese: 总之，我坚决反对存私房钱。

sentences.english: You could save some every month, like a lot of other people do.
sentences.chinese: 你可以像其他人那样，每个月都存点儿钱。

sentences.english: The real barrier to developing this habit is finding money to save.
sentences.chinese: 养成这个习惯的真正障碍是找来要存的钱。

sentences.english: The question and prospect of vitrified cryopreservation on animal tissues and cells are suggested.
sentences.chinese: 并提出了玻璃化冻存动物以及组织细胞的问题与展望。

to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things

coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
